issues.title: RB26DETT Engine Oil Pump Failure
issues.description: The oil pump in the RB26DETT engine can fail due to high RPM use and age, leading to catastrophic engine damage. The pump's internals wear out and lose pressure, starving the engine of lubrication.
issues.fix_description: Replace oil pump with upgraded unit, potentially requiring engine rebuild if damage occurred
issues.prevention: Regular oil changes, avoid sustained high RPM, monitor oil pressure gauge

issues.title: ATTESA-ETS All-Wheel Drive System Malfunction
issues.description: The ATTESA-ETS AWD system can develop faults in the transfer case, causing loss of rear-wheel power distribution and triggering error codes. Common issues include pump failure and solenoid problems.
issues.fix_description: Rebuild or replace transfer case, replace faulty solenoids and pump
issues.prevention: Regular ATF changes, avoid launch control abuse, inspect transfer case fluid regularly

issues.title: Ceramic Turbocharger Wheel Failure
issues.description: The factory ceramic turbine wheels in the twin turbos are prone to shattering under high boost or temperature cycling, causing immediate turbo failure and potential engine damage.
symptoms: Loud grinding or whistling from turbos
Blue or white smoke from exhaust
issues.fix_description: Replace turbos with steel wheel units, inspect and clean intercooler system
issues.prevention: Upgrade to steel wheel turbos, proper cooldown procedures, quality fuel and oil

issues.title: Fuel Injector Failure
issues.description: The side-feed fuel injectors commonly fail due to age and ethanol fuel exposure, causing misfires, poor running, and potential engine damage from lean conditions.
issues.fix_description: Replace all six fuel injectors with new or refurbished units, clean fuel rail
issues.prevention: Use quality fuel, regular fuel system cleaning, replace fuel filter regularly

issues.title: Mass Air Flow Sensor Degradation
issues.description: The MAF sensor becomes contaminated or degrades over time, causing incorrect air/fuel mixture calculations and poor engine performance.
issues.fix_description: Clean or replace MAF sensor, inspect air filter and intake system
issues.prevention: Regular air filter changes, avoid over-oiling performance air filters

issues.title: Radiator and Cooling System Failure
issues.description: The factory radiator and cooling system components are inadequate for high-performance use, leading to overheating issues, especially during track use or hot weather.
issues.fix_description: Upgrade radiator, replace thermostat, water pump, and cooling system hoses
issues.prevention: Regular coolant flushes, upgrade cooling system for performance use, monitor temperatures

issues.title: Clutch Pressure Plate and Disc Wear
issues.description: The factory clutch system wears rapidly under spirited driving and cannot handle increased power levels, leading to slippage and eventual failure.
issues.fix_description: Replace clutch disc, pressure plate, and release bearing with performance units
issues.prevention: Proper clutch technique, avoid riding the clutch, upgrade for modified engines

issues.title: Boost Control Solenoid Failure
issues.description: The boost control solenoid can fail or stick, causing overboosting or underboosting conditions that affect performance and potentially damage the engine.
issues.fix_description: Replace boost control solenoid, check vacuum lines and connections
issues.prevention: Regular inspection of vacuum system, quality fuel to prevent contamination

issues.title: Differential Mount Failure
issues.description: The rear differential mounts deteriorate over time, especially with hard driving, causing excessive movement and vibration through the drivetrain.
issues.fix_description: Replace differential mounts with upgraded polyurethane or solid mounts
issues.prevention: Inspect mounts regularly, avoid excessive wheel spin and hard launches

issues.title: Interior Climate Control Unit Failure
issues.description: The digital climate control unit commonly fails due to capacitor aging, causing loss of air conditioning and heating control functions.
issues.fix_description: Repair or replace climate control unit, replace capacitors in existing unit
issues.prevention: Avoid extreme temperature exposure, regular use of climate system

issues.title: Wheel Speed Sensor Failure
issues.description: ABS wheel speed sensors fail due to corrosion and age, causing ABS and traction control system malfunctions and warning lights.
issues.fix_description: Replace faulty wheel speed sensor, clean sensor mounting area
issues.prevention: Regular brake system inspection, protect from road salt and debris

editorial.hero_blurb: The R34 GT-R represents the pinnacle of Nissan's analog sports car engineering before electronics took over. With its legendary RB26DETT heart and ATTESA-ETS all-wheel drive, it's the most refined and capable of the classic GT-R lineage.
editorial.essence: The R34 is pure mechanical symphony wrapped in purposeful bodywork. It's the last GT-R where you feel every component working in harmony, from the twin-turbo straight-six to the sophisticated AWD system that made it unbeatable on track and street.
editorial.heritage: Final evolution of the legendary Skyline GT-R bloodline that began in 1969, building on the R32's dominance and R33's refinement. The R34 perfected the formula before the brand moved to the more electronic R35 generation.
editorial.design_philosophy: Form follows function with aggressive aerodynamics and cooling vents integrated into clean, muscular lines. Every element serves performance, from the distinctive quad taillights to the functional hood vents.
editorial.motorsport_history: Dominated Super GT and numerous international touring car championships. The RB26DETT engine became legendary in drag racing and time attack, capable of massive power increases with modification.
editorial.engine_character: The RB26DETT is automotive poetry - smooth as silk at idle, building to a ferocious howl at redline. Twin turbos deliver explosive mid-range punch with that distinctive straight-six mechanical precision.
editorial.transmission_feel: The Getrag 6-speed is precise and mechanical, requiring deliberate inputs but rewarding with direct connection. Each shift feels substantial and purposeful, especially under boost.
editorial.chassis_dynamics: ATTESA-ETS AWD system provides incredible traction and adjustable torque split. The chassis is planted yet playful, with neutral handling that can transition to controllable oversteer when provoked.
editorial.steering_feel: Properly weighted with excellent on-center feel and progressive loading through corners. Communicates road surface and grip levels clearly without being overly heavy or twitchy.
editorial.brake_confidence: Brembo 4-pot fronts provide strong, progressive stopping power with excellent pedal feel. Capable of repeated hard use with proper cooling, though pads may fade on track without upgrades.
editorial.sound_signature: Deep, mechanical straight-six rumble at idle building to a screaming wail at redline. Turbo whoosh and blow-off valve symphony adds theater, while the exhaust note is pure motorsport aggression.
editorial.ideal_owner: Serious enthusiasts who appreciate mechanical purity and don't mind hands-on ownership. Perfect for collectors, track day warriors, and those seeking the ultimate analog sports car experience.
editorial.not_ideal_for: Daily commuter seekers, those wanting modern luxury features, or owners expecting trouble-free maintenance. The R34 demands respect, knowledge, and proper care.
editorial.buyers_summary: Prices have reached stratospheric levels, making condition and provenance critical. Find the cleanest, most documented example possible and budget significantly for maintenance and potential restoration.

fitment.clearance_notes: OEM fitment with no clearance issues
May require fender work for full lock steering
fitment.known_issues: Potential inner fender contact at full compression
Rubbing likely without proper suspension and bodywork

warnings.message: City MPG should be less than highway MPG
⚠️ VERIFY: brembo brakes listed but Nissan Skyline GT-R R34 may not come with brembo stock. This could be an aftermarket upgrade confused with OEM specs.
⚠️ VERIFY: "4-piston brembo" calipers are uncommon on stock vehicles. Most OEM brakes use 1-2 piston sliding calipers.
